citation.article-title: Phenotypic and phylogenetic characterization of some unknown coryneform bacteria isolated from bovine blood and milk: description of Sanguibacter gen.nov.

p.s: Sanguibacter suarezii (su.ar.ézi.i. M.L. gen.n. suarezii, named In honour of G. Suarez, a Spanish veterinary microbiologist)
Cells consist of Gram-positive, short, irregular shaped motile rods.
Colonies are circular, convex, with entire edges and pale yellow in colour.
Colonies are approximately 0.5 mm in diameter after 48 h of incubation on TSA.

Acid is produced from glycerol, L-arabinose, ribose, D-xylose, β-methylxyloside, galactose, glucose, fructose, D-mannose, arbutin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, glycogen, β-gentibiose, turanose, lyxose, amygdalin and rhamnose.
Some strains produce acid from D-raffinose.

Acid is not produced from erythritol, D-arabinose, adonitol, sorbose, inositol, melezitose, xylitol, D-tagatose, fucose, arabitol, inulin, gluconate, mannitol, α-methyl-D-mannoside, α-methyl-wglucoside and N-acetylglucosamine.
Nitrate is reduced by most strains.
Cellulose, casein, gelatin and Tween 80 are not hydrolysed.
The G + C content of DNA of the type strain is 69.5 mol%.
